citeinfo.origin: Rocky Wagner, Louisiana Coastal Protection and Restoration Authority, Senior Coastal Resources Scientist
citeinfo.title: aoc_deep_01

descript.abstract: AOC suitability index for deep water operations (assumes larger boats with refrigeration capability) based on oyster viability and commercial viability; year 1. Deep-water operations are assumed to use larger vessels and are limited to areas with water depths of greater than 5 ft.
descript.purpose: The project team (Royal Engineers and Consultants, LLC; Lynker, Inc; and Denise Reed, LLC) developed models to describe the suitability of Louisiana waters for oyster farming using either traditional culture or alternative oyster culture (AOC) methods and developed geospatial layers to quantify each element of the traditional culture and AOC models (e.g., salinity, sediment deposition, land/water, fetch, etc.). Model results were developed based on 10 years of outputs from the 2023 Coastal Master Plan models. The naming convention for these files includes the parameter name, followed by either the model year (01-10) or an indication of whether the output represents a mean or standard deviation of all years. Additional information can be found in the project team report, available on request from CPRA.

theme.themekey: Predictive, Model, 2023 Coastal Master Plan, Louisiana, LA, Coastal Zone

idinfo.datacred: The model code was developed in R by Lynker, Inc., under a subcontract to Royal Engineers and Consultants, LLC.

cntorgp.cntorg: Louisiana Coastal Protection and Restoration Authority
